nodes.bodyText:
+1
On that note, fyi - we are going to be adding a custom response type (inherited from ResponseBase<H, T>), which we will return from these public APIs (for APIs that should return json string). Strongly typed objects can be returned as-is from the PL.

nodes.bodyText:
That was my concern as well, although I believe I recommended that we use modelClass.
Since every type that we want to convert to is essentially a "model" in programming terms, I thought this should be ok, although I can see the potential for confusion with ADT models.
I think classType is well descriptive, we can use that. (I am sure the SDK board will push back if that goes against java naming conventions. )

nodes.bodyText:
You'll probably need to update this to Mono<Response<Void>>, else it'll complain about using raw unparameterized form of Response<T>; but you can make that change when you actually implement the API -> you'll get a warning on intellij.
I'll leave it to you to update it as you see fit.
